item.title: Cris add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "A Paradox, the doughnut hole. Empty space, once, but now they've learned to market even that. A minus quantity; nothing, rendered edible. I wondered if they might be used-metaphorically, of course-to demonstrate the existence of God. Does naming a sphere of nothingness transmute it into being?" -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Cris add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Every reader, as he reads, is actually the reader of himself. The writer's work is only a kind of optical instrument he provides the reader so he can discern what he might never have seen in himself without this book. The reader's recognition in himself of what the book says is the proof of the book's truth." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Cris add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "The first thing I learned at school was that some people are idiots; the second thing I learned was that some are even worse. " -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Cris add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I don't want to be a tree; I want to be its meaning." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Cris add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "In the space between chaos and shape there was another chance." -- Jeanette Winterson
